description.narrative: Market Signal: JBIC''s involvement in the Project sends an important market signal to international investors endorsing Sri Lanka as an investment target. This will have a key impact on FDI flows particularly at a time when the country is emerging from a 26 year civil war and there is ongoing uncertainty in global financial markets. Strengthen Systemic Impact: A stronger capital base will enable CBC to enhance its systemic contribution to finance the post-conflict reconstruction efforts in the North and East of the country and infrastructure projects identified as a national priority to accelerate economic growth. Increased Access to Finance: CBC is a major SME lender in Sri Lanka, comprising nearly a third of its portfolio. The Project will provide additional funding for the SME sector, which is a key driver of economic growth, and the tangible development outcome of this financing will be monitored through the incremental increase in the Bank''s SME portfolio. Promote Regional Integration: The Project will help promote regional economic integration by supporting the expansion of CBC''s expansion of its regional presence. Optimize Capital Structure of Banks: The Project meets a key priority of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka in raising Tier 2 capital to optimize the capital structure of key domestic banks. Tier 2 capital is relatively new in Sri Lanka and nor widely prevalent since weak market conditions have precluded banks from readily accessing subordinated debt.
The proposed project consists of a subordinated debt investment of US$ 75 million which will strengthen the Tier 2 capital base of CBC, a systemically important bank in Sri Lanka.
